required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiple Dose Pharmacokinetics of LCZ696 and Its Metabolites in Subjects With Severe Renal Impairment vs. Matched Healthy Subjects With Normal Renal Function
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Parallel-group Study to Determine Multiple Dose Pharmacokinetics of LCZ696 and Its Metabolites in Subjects With Severe Renal Impairment Compared to Matched Healthy Subjects With Normal Renal Function

brief_summary.textblock: An open label, parallel-group study to determine multiple dose pharmacokinetics of LCZ696 and its metabolites in subjects with severe renal impairment compared to matched healthy subjects with normal renal function

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Peak Plasma Concentration (Tmax) After Single Dose (Day 1), and After Multiple Dose Administration (Day 5)
(Cmax) After Single Dose (Day 1), and After Multiple Dose Administration (Day 5)
AUC 0-24h After Single Dose (Day 1), and After Multiple Dose Administration (Day 5)

primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics for plasma PK parameters following 5 days QD dose of 400mg LCZ696
Summary statistics for plasma PK parameters following 5 days QD dose of 400mg LCZ696
Summary statistics for plasma PK parameters following 5 days QD dose of 400mg LCZ696

secondary_outcome.measure: 24 hr Sodium Urinary Excretion in Subjects With Severe Renal Impairment and Their Matched Healthy Volunteers

arm_group.description: once daily administration of 400 mg LCZ696 for 5 days
once daily administration of 400 mg LCZ696 for 5 days

intervention.description: once daily administration of 400 mg LCZ696 for 5 days

group.title: Severe Renal Impaired Subjects
group.description: Subjects with severe (CrCl from <30 mL/min), renal function who were otherwise in good health as determined by past medical history, physical examination, electrocardiogram, vital signs (measured after 3 minutes rest in the supine position) which are within the following ranges; oral body temperature between 35.0-37.8°C, systolic blood pressure (95-180 mm Hg), diastolic blood pressure (60-110 mm Hg), pulse rate (54-95 bpm), laboratory tests and urinalysis. Creatinine clearance (CrCl) was calculated by the Cockcroft-Gault (CG) formula with patient stratification based on the screening serum creatinine measurement. Once daily administration of 400 mg LCZ696 p.o. for 5 days

group.title: Matched Healthy Volunteers
group.description: All healthy volunteers were matched by age (±5 years), sex and BMI (±10%) to the renal subjects enrolled into the study. Subjects were to be in good health as determined by past medical history, physical examination, electrocardiogram, vital signs (measured after 3 minutes rest in the supine position) which are within the following ranges; oral body temperature between 35.0-37.2 °C, systolic blood pressure (95-140 mm Hg), diastolic blood, pressure (60-100 mm Hg), pulse rate (45-90 bpm), laboratory tests and urinalysis. Healthy subjects must have a CrCl of >80 mL/min.Once daily administration of 400 mg LCZ696 p.o. for 5 days

Creatinine clearance (CrCl) was calculated by the Cockcroft-Gault (CG) formula with patient stratification based on the screening serum creatinine measurement. Once daily administration of 400 mg LCZ696 p.o. for 5 days

Healthy subjects must have a CrCl of >80 mL/min. Once daily administration of 400 mg LCZ696 p.o. for 5 days

measurement_list.measurement: LBQ657 is a metabolite of AHU377, and hence LBQ657 CL/F values are not relevant.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events are monitored from date of First Subject First Visit (FSFV) until Last Subject Last Visit (LSLV). All other adverse events are monitored from First Subject First Treatment (FSFT) until Last Subject Last Visit (LSLV).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial
